SENT.plain: Two cases of infantile cortical hyperostosis (Caffrey's disease) are presented
This syndrome is characterized by diaphyseal cortical swelling of flat bones as well as long bones, often polyostotic but sometimes confirmed to one bone, e.g. the mandible
Prominent clinical features are irritability and painful firm swelling of soft tissues, as well as pallor and subfebrile temperatures
Serological reactions and blood cultures are negative and histological findings are non-specific
Differential diagnosis should account for bone syphilis, hypervitaminosis A, battered child syndrome and osteomyelitis
